Text:
Annerose waits in a corridor leading to the stands
for a particular match to start.

Lemme guess, yer waitin' for the next match, not this
piss-poor excuse for a slapfight, ain't ya.
Oh, aren't you...

Quinton. You saw that third round yesterday,
yes?

Quinton appears beside Annerose, looking for all the
world like a heel pro wrestler.
Yeah. I take it you did too?
Yeah, didn't mean to, but I caught it.
Mundane Mann... What'd you make of the guy?

Well, it certainly didn't look like he won by luck
because his opponent tripped.

No way in hell. That runt did somethin', I know it.
I dunno what exactly, but maybe you do...
Annerose Nichtsehen of Velgalta's Seven Blades.
I no longer go by that title. I'm just Annerose now.

My bad. Lemme offer ya a belated congrats for your
win at the Goddess' Trial.
Thanks.

Still, gotta say I'm surprised you don't know.
What trick that rat used, I mean.
I couldn't catch it all. Not even with my eyesight.
What I am certain of, though...
is that Mundane's right hand looked like it moved.
Huh, his right hand, eh?

Yes. I don't know what he did with his hand, but I'm
positive it moved.

The only other thing I can say is that it did so at
incredible speed.
Hmph. Sounds like I guessed wrong.
Quinton snorts disinterestedly.

I thought maybe he used some sorta time-stop
artifact.
That's not entirely impossible either.
Anyways, we'll know after today's match.

He's up against Goldy Gilded the Unbeaten Legend,
who's never lost a fight.

Huh. I've never heard of 'em, but sounds like he's
a famous guy. Is he strong?

He's made a name for himself, for better or worse.
I've been matched up with him three times in past
tournaments.

But if this Goldy's never lost...does that mean you
did?
Of course not. We never actually fought.
Huh? What the hell does that mean?

He makes a point of never facing any opponents he
might lose to, so he withdraws the moment any such
name shows up next to his on the brackets.

That's how he earned the name "the Unbeaten Legend".
He isn't too fond of that title though, so he calls
himself "the Victorious Golden Dragon."

Heheheh... "Victorious" and "unbeaten," eh? They
sound similar but mean totally different things.
I wonder.

He only fights where he's certain to win, so he's
able to worm his way into higher seed positions.
He's even won a few smaller competitions.
I see. So it's not that he's weak.

Goldy's forte is accurately reading differences in
ability. That's why he didn't flinch from facing
Mundane.

I get it now... So either the Unbeaten Legend has the
wrong idea about what Mundane's capable of, or
Mundane's a coward who has to rely on artifacts...

And what's more, the Unbeaten Legend has only ever
fought when he was guaranteed to win. In other words,
he's never had to actually get serious in a match.
So this is gonna be interestin'.
Yes.

Mundane Mann and Goldy Gilded stand facing each other
amidst a shower of cheers and jeers.

Only two people in the audience understand the true
significance of this match.

Round four, match six! Goldy Gilded versus Mundane
Mann!
Let the match begin!
Oraaaaah!!!

Goldy strikes first, closing the distance with his foe
in a flash the moment the fight begins.

He swings his ostentatiously decorated two-handed
sword straight at Mundane's head.

Mundane meanwhile has yet to draw his own weapon.
He just stands there without a reaction.
Goldy displays a toothy grin, sure of his victory.
Suddenly, there is a popping sound.
